text: {{Infobox writer | name = Urdu poet of Mughal era Mir Taqi Mir | image = Mir Taqi Mir 1786.jpg | imagesize = | caption = | pseudonym = Mir | birth_date = 1723 | birth_place = Agra | death_date = 1810 (aged 87) | death_place = Lucknow | occupation = Urdu poet | nationality = Indian | period = Mughal era | genre = Ghazal | subject = Love, Philosophy | movement = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }} Mir Taqi Mir (born 1723 in Agra - died September 21, 1810 in Lucknow). He was an Urdu poet and one of the pioneers who gave Urdu shape to itself. He is remembered as Khuda-e-Sukhan which means "god of poetry".Legendary Urdu poet Mir Taqi Mir passed away, [The Times of India], Rajiv Srivastava, TNN, Sep 19, 2010, 05.58am IST His father's name was syed ali muttaqi . ==References== Category:1723 births Category:1810 deaths Category:Indian poets Category:Urdu poets Category:People from Lucknow Category:People from Delhi Category:18th-century writers Category:19th-century Indian poets
title: Mir Taqi Mir
